resources.string: Tomato anthracnose is a serious disease of processing tomatoes caused by the fungus Colletotrichum coccodes. Early symptoms appear on ripe fruit as small, slightly sunken, watersoaked circular spots
Bacterial speck is caused by Pseudomonas syringae pv. tomato. The foliar symptoms of speck consist of small (1/8-1/4 in.) black lesions, often with a discrete yellow halo.

Bacterial spot is caused by Xanthomonas campesiris pv, vesicatoria. Infected leaves show small, irregular, dark lesions (fig. 6), which can coalesce and cause the leaves to develop a general yellowing.
